result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Per order of Judge Dorow on 9/21/2022, the case has been administratively transferred to Branch 5.

10:25 AM Defendant Justin M Backler in court.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for status. Defendant qualified for public defender, but one has not been appointed at this time. 
Court authorizes administrative transfer of this case to join companion cases assigned to Branch 5.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victim A/witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

3:10 PM Defendant Justin M Backler in court, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer, as a friend of the court, in court for Justin M Backler. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Defendant was not evaluated by the public defender's office.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT. Defendant does not have a mailing address or phone number.  Defendant is trying to set up mailing address at the Department of Health and Human Services.
Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 08/30/2022.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
